Man dies after police interaction at Auckland City Mission site in central Auckland: Cops begin probe, IPCA notified https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/man-dies-after-police-interaction-in-central-auckland-cops-begin-probe-ipca-notified/RN3JQDLBYREQ7CZWCXDA3SAUSE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/man-dies-after-police-interaction-in-central-auckland-cops-begin-probe-ipca-notified/RN3JQDLBYREQ7CZWCXDA3SAUSE/ Raphael Franks, Nazahryth BernardThe Herald was told by an anonymous source the man was homeless. Sun, 10 Nov 2024 08:05:25 +0000 Police are investigating the death of a man who fell and struck his head during an interaction with police in central Auckland. Photo / Bevan Conley
Stalking to become illegal, punishable by up to five years’ jail https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/stalking-to-become-illegal-punishable-by-up-to- Five-years-jail/VIBR3QCBGNBEJOVI2KKSMROAAU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/stalking-to-become-illegal-punishable-by-up-to- Five-years-jail/VIBR3QCBGNBEJOVI2KKSMROAAU/ The new law will define stalking as a pattern of behaviours in a 12-month period. Sun, 10 Nov 2024 07:41:43 +0000 Patterns of behaviours will be captured in the new offence, including the use of modern technology in modern stalking methods. Photo / 123rf
Epsom Girls Grammar principal emails parents after Herald reports into ex-teacher Peter Thomas https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/epsom-girls-grammar-principal-emails-parents-after-herald-reports-into-ex-teacher-peter-thomas/LM6XTF5ULRD7RCXNBKEDCMPOZ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/epsom-girls-grammar-principal-emails-parents-after-herald-reports-into-ex-teacher-peter-thomas/LM6XTF5ULRD7RCXNBKEDCMPOZ4/ The principal has emailed parents about steps being taken to keep girls safe. Sun, 10 Nov 2024 07:20:59 +0000 Disgraced Epsom Girls’ Grammar music teacher Peter Thomas. A second former student says she also complained about him to the school.
Village Radio ready to relocate rare record relics https://www.nzherald.co.nz/sunlive/news/village-radio-ready-to-relocate-rare-record-relics/6HEZ2P3T25FF5AXJJW5TK24IZA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/sunlive/news/village-radio-ready-to-relocate-rare-record-relics/6HEZ2P3T25FF5AXJJW5TK24IZA/ Tom EleyVillage Radio moves, relocating 20,000 records and vintage broadcasting equipment. Sun, 10 Nov 2024 06:12:00 +0000 From left, announcers Evan Turbott, Rob Golsby, Christine Giddens with station manager Tony Rhind. They and 30 volunteers will be relocating in February 2025 to the dance studio in the Historic Village. Photo / Brydie Thompson

Sun, 10 Nov 2024 05:00:00 +0000 Jaimon Swann appears in the Auckland District Court for sentencing on drugs charges. Photo / Sylvie Whinray
Mongols MC anniversary event: Police arrest 30 people in Canterbury crackdown https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mongols-mc-anniversary-event-police-arrest-30-people-in-canterbury-crackdown/HRLCPU4TAVF65LJEJIE5MEIZLM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mongols-mc-anniversary-event-police-arrest-30-people-in-canterbury-crackdown/HRLCPU4TAVF65LJEJIE5MEIZLM/ Cops cracked down in Canterbury amid an influx of the club's members and associates.
